etymology.description: semantic: 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") + phonetic: 封(封) (fēng) = covering with earth to close -> seal; close
etymology.interpretation: The character 封(封) (fēng) combines the semantic component 土(土) (tǔ, "earth"), suggesting covering or enclosing something, with a phonetic component to convey the sound. It evokes the idea of sealing or closing something, like covering with earth.

examples.chinese: 收到信后(收到信後)，他们封好包裹(他們封好包裹)。
examples.pinyin: Shōu dào xìn hòu, tāmen fēng hǎo bāoguǒ.
examples.english: After receiving the letter, they sealed the package.
